item.title: Lyst, a fashion marketplace once valued at $700M, sells to Japan’s Zozo for $154M
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description: Fashion goes in and out of style, and it turns out, so do fashion startups. Lyst, a high-end fashion marketplace that was once valued at $700 million, has been acquired for just $154 million in cash by Zozo, a Japan-based fashion and e-commerce business. Zozo owns a number of fashion brands that include Wear by […]

item.title: Governments identify dozens of Android apps bundled with spyware
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: The advisories say the spyware apps are used to target members of civil society who may oppose China’s state interests.

item.title: A 25-year-old police drone founder just raised $75M led by Index
item.dc:creator: Charles Rollet
item.description: If you ever call 911 from an area that’s hard to get to, you might hear the buzz of a drone well before a police cruiser pulls up. And there’s a good chance that it will be one made by Brinc Drones, a Seattle-based startup founded by 25-year-old Blake Resnick, who dropped out of college […]

item.title: Instagram is beefing up its search to compete with TikTok
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Instagram head Adam Mosseri says the company is looking to improve the app’s search functionality, admitting this is an area where Instagram could do more to compete. The remarks, made on a recent episode of the “Build Your Tribe” podcast, come at a time when younger Gen Z users often turn to social apps like […]

item.title: Deep Cogito emerges from stealth with hybrid AI ‘reasoning’ models
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: A new company, Deep Cogito, has emerged from stealth with a family of openly available AI models that can be switched between “reasoning” and non-reasoning modes. Reasoning models like OpenAI’s o1 have shown great promise in domains like math and physics, thanks to their ability to effectively fact-check themselves by working through complex problems step […]

item.title: No, Stripe is not becoming a bank
item.dc:creator: Mary Ann Azevedo
item.description: Last week, details emerged about an application that fintech giant Stripe had submitted for a U.S. banking license. There was a lot of chatter on X about whether this meant Stripe — already the largest privately valued fintech in the world — would now be adding “bank” to the list of descriptions of what it […]

item.title: Inside the EV startup secretly backed by Jeff Bezos
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Jeff Bezos is funding a secretive EV startup based in Michigan called Slate Auto that could start production as soon as next year, according to multiple sources and documents that link the billionaire’s family office to the startup. Slate, which took root in another Bezos-connected company called Re:Build Manufacturing, has been operating quietly since its […]

item.title: At last, MrBeast weighs in on the global economic crisis du jour
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Your 401k is suffering. The billionaires are fighting. The gamers are imperiled. Not even the penguins on McDonald Island, where no humans reside, have been spared. But at long last, 26-year-old YouTuber and chocolatier MrBeast has weighed in on President Donald Trump’s controversial plan to impose sweeping tariffs on imports. Jokes aside, the prolific YouTuber […]

item.title: Does Colossal Biosciences’ dire wolf creation justify its $10B+ valuation?
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: On Monday, the “de-extinction” startup Colossal Biosciences announced its most ambitious results to date: the dire wolf. These are creatures that have been extinct for more than 12,000 years and made famous by the HBO show “Game of Thrones.” These white, fluffy animals live on a 2,000-acre preserve in a location so secretive that journalists, […]

item.title: A nonprofit is using AI agents to raise money for charity
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: Tech giants like Microsoft might be touting AI “agents” as profit-boosting tools for corporations, but a nonprofit is trying to prove that agents can be a force for good, too. Sage Future, a 501(c)(3) backed by Open Philanthropy, launched an experiment earlier this month tasking four AI models in a virtual environment with raising money […]

item.title: Tapestry’s app can now de-dupe your social feeds
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Tapestry, a new app designed to organize the open social web, is adding a valuable feature to help people who are keeping up with multiple social networks: It will now remove duplicate posts from your feed. That means if you follow the same person across social networking services like Bluesky and Mastodon, you won’t have […]

item.title: Google fixes two Android zero-day bugs actively exploited by hackers
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: The most severe security bug can be exploited without user interaction, per Google.

item.title: Take the stage at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025: Apply to speak now
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: If you’re reading this, consider it your signal: The opportunity to influence the future of tech is here. TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 is now accepting speaker applications. Join us onstage this October 27–29 at Moscone West in San Francisco and share your ideas with 10,000+ tech leaders, VCs, and innovators shaping what’s next. Apply to speak […]

item.title: Amazon’s Zoox begins robotaxi testing in Los Angeles
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Zoox, Amazon’s autonomous vehicle unit, is deploying a small fleet of retrofitted test vehicles on the streets of Los Angeles starting Tuesday — a modest, yet meaningful step as the company inches toward offering public rides in Las Vegas and San Francisco later this year. The data-collection effort marks Zoox’s entrance into its sixth city […]

item.title: Los Angeles-based Rain raised a $75M Series B in another good sign for fintech
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Rain, a startup offering an employer-integrated earned wage access (EWA) app coupled with financial-wellness features like overdraft alerts and spending trends, has raised $75 million in an all-equity Series B round. The round was led by Prosus at a post-money valuation of $340 million. Rain plans to use the new funds to help it add […]

item.title: Founders, TechCrunch Startup Battlefield 200 is calling! Apply to enter!
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Founders, the battlefield is calling! Startup Battlefield 200 applications are now live — and the race has begun. If you’ve got a groundbreaking idea and the guts to pitch it to the world, TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 is your arena. You’ll face elite VC judges. You’ll compete against 199 of the world’s most promising startups. And […]

item.title: Trump to endorse coal for data center power in the face of grim market realities
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: An executive order will direct the federal government to list coal as a critical mineral and force some coal-fired power plants to keep generating electricity.

item.title: Volunteer your time for a free ticket to TechCrunch Sessions: AI
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Join us for an unforgettable opportunity at TechCrunch Sessions: AI, happening at UC Berkeley’s Zellerbach Hall on June 5! We’re on the lookout for enthusiastic volunteers to be part of this exciting event. If you’ve ever wondered what goes into the making of tech gatherings, now’s your chance to find out firsthand. Apply here by […]

item.title: Waymo may use interior camera data to train generative AI models, but riders will be able to opt out
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Waymo is preparing to use data from its robotaxis, including video from interior cameras tied to rider identities, to train generative AI models, according to an unreleased version of its privacy policy found by researcher Jane Manchun Wong, raising fresh questions about how much of a rider’s behavior inside autonomous vehicles could be repurposed for […]

item.title: Meet the new Audience Choice winners to lead breakouts at TechCrunch Sessions: AI
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: You voted. They rose to the top! Meet the two Audience Choice winners who’ll take the breakout stage at TechCrunch Sessions: AI on June 5 in Zellerbach Hall at UC Berkeley to share their insights with 1,200 AI leaders and enthusiasts. We sifted through hundreds of Call for Content submissions and narrowed them down to […]
